Summary: bright light over north Spokane Valley
trends: There have been no other sightings in Otis Orchards-East Farms
This sighting has never been favorited.
divs: sighting detailsi went outside with my pet last night about 9:15. looking up at the sky, i noticed the usual green\red\white "stars" were in the skies to the southeast, north, south, and southwest as they have been for about 5 years or so now. they don't move with the constellations as they should but they do appear in different locations some nights, again not moving with the constellations. sometimes, there are only 2 or 3 but most nights there are 4. they tend to take up residence near tv towers, cellphone towers, or the mica peak weather observation post. the nws tries to explain them away as venus or mars but they're really full of it! anyway, i came back in and went to close the curtains in my front room when i noticed a bright white light just above the cellphone towers in north spokane valley. it didn't move and was extremely bright white (like a roman candle but no tail and it didn't drop), and then i saw what looked like a helicopter with red lights approach from the south and get close to the light, and abruptly flew away. about the same time that the helicopter left, the green\red\white "star" to the southwest looked as if it got a lot closer and became very bright. once the helicopter lights disappeared completely, the "star" reverted to its original position. the bright light then dropped closer to the cellphone tower's height. approximately 10 min later, the bright white light disappeared behind the cellphone tower hill altogether. i still don't know what the heck is going on with these "stars" but it's becoming more frequent of late. not to mention the two unexplained "brush fires" since last summer (2009) on the southeastern hills near mica peak that no one seems to notice or give news time to. and i don't think they are coming because they are already here.
